medical_history.chief_complaint: Functional visual loss (FVL) in the setting of idiopathic intracranial hypertension (IIH).
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: 11 patients had FVL at initial presentation, and 6 patients developed FVL during follow-up. Symptoms included visual disturbances such as tunnel vision and blurred vision with increased headache, and examination findings showed stabilization or worsening of visual fields over time.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Many patients had significant psychiatric and medical comorbidities, including bipolar disorder, substance abuse disorders, and chronic diseases such as diabetes and fibromyalgia.
medical_history.social_history: One patient was living in a halfway house and periodically homeless; other relevant social histories are not specified.
